title: When does Vikings season 6 start? New trailer promises 'insanity'
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Vikings season six is going to be a wild ride from the looks of this new trailer.

The show’s sixth and final season promises more of the spectacular blood and guts chaos that fans have come to know and love from the show.

In the new clip we catch up with some of the main players from the last season, and there’s even a nice mention of Floki to really get fans in the mood for more.

Star Alexander Ludwig shared the trailer on his Instagram page and talked up what viewers can look forward to.

He said: ‘The finale season begins December 4th! WHOS READY FOR THE INSANITY?!’.

Meanwhile Alexander’s co-stars Katheryn Winnick and Alex Høgh Andersen have teased their favourite scenes from the upcoming season, which includes an ‘epic’ battle.

Katheryn, who plays Lagertha, said: ‘I guess my most memorable battle has to be Lagertha’s next battle in season six.

We are expecting ‘insanity’ in the new season (Picture: History)

‘It is epic, took weeks to rehearse, lots of blood, sweat and tears.

‘It is definitely going to be something you have never seen before.’

Alex explained: ‘My favourite battle scene when shooting Vikings is from an episode called Homeland.

There’s going to be some epic fight scenes (Picture: History)

‘My character, Ivar The Boneless, is charging into battle, and he’s really eager to get there, and yet when he finally arrives he gets knocked off the chariot.

‘Straight away he finds himself all along on the battlefield, facing a hundred Saxon soldiers.’

Fondly recalling the moment, he laughed: ‘We shot that scene for 10 hours a day, two days in a row, in the pouring rain, and I was covered in blood from head to toe, screaming all day long. But that was tonnes of fun.’

Vikings season 6 returns to History Channel on December 4.
